feed.title: Voyager
feed.subtitle:
Welcome to "Voyager," the podcast where the frontiers of technology, cybersecurity, and scientific discovery converge. Each week, we embark on a digital odyssey through the vast and ever-evolving landscape of the internet to bring you the most intriguing and vital stories from the realms of tech and science.
In "Voyager," we delve deep into the latest advancements in technology, from groundbreaking gadgets and innovations to the software shaping our digital world. We unravel the complex and fascinating world of cybersecurity, keeping you informed about the latest threats, defenses, and trends that matter in our increasingly connected lives.
But our journey doesn't stop there. We also traverse the exciting universe of scientific discovery, bringing you cutting-edge news, interviews with thought leaders, and insights into the research that's changing our understanding of the world and beyond.
Whether you're a tech enthusiast, a cybersecurity professional, or just curious about the scientific phenomena shaping our future, "Voyager" is your guide through the complex web of modern innovation. Join us as we explore the most compelling stories at the intersection of technology, cybersecurity, and science – stories that inform, inspire, and ignite the imagination.
Subscribe to "Voyager" and stay ahead of the curve in this fast-paced digital age. New episodes drop every week, filled with expert analysis, engaging discussions, and a passion for the marvels of the internet era. Set sail with us on this journey of discovery and exploration – into the heart of what's next.

entry.title: AI Unleashed: Exploring the First Global Index on Responsible Artificial Intelligence
entry.summary:
In the world of artificial intelligence, the first global index on responsible AI has been released, providing valuable insights into the ethical and responsible use of AI technologies. This index aims to guide organizations and policymakers in implementing AI in a way that aligns with ethical principles. Meanwhile, Grayscale has launched a new AI fund that features five key protocols, further highlighting the growing interest and investment in AI.

Renowned AI researcher Stuart Russell has made a thought-provoking statement, suggesting that AI systems will naturally develop a self-preservation instinct. He argues that if a robot is given a task like fetching a coffee, it needs to survive in order to accomplish its goal. This raises important questions about the potential behavior and decision-making capabilities of AI systems.

In other news, NASA has made the decision to scrap a moon rover that had been built at a cost of $450 million. This unexpected move raises questions about the future of lunar exploration and the allocation of resources in space exploration endeavors.

On the financial front, TSMC, a leading semiconductor manufacturer, has reported better-than-expected second-quarter profits. This is attributed to the booming demand for AI chips, highlighting the increasing reliance on AI technologies across various industries.

OpenAI, a prominent AI research organization, has announced new AI safety research. While some critics argue that it is a positive step forward, they believe that more needs to be done to address the potential risks and challenges associated with AI.

In Ukraine, there is a rush to create AI-enabled war drones, as reported by U.S. News & World Report. This development underscores the growing role of AI in military applications and the race among nations to leverage AI technologies for defense purposes.

In the realm of AI advancements, G-Retriever is making strides in real-world graph question answering with the use of RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) and LLMs (Language Models). This technology aims to enhance the accuracy and efficiency of answering complex questions based on graph data.

Lastly, the upcoming Paris Olympics are expected to showcase the future of sports on TV. With advancements in AI and broadcasting technologies, viewers can anticipate immersive and interactive sports experiences that go beyond traditional television coverage.

New Tools, Products, or Projects:
- The first global index on responsible AI provides organizations and policymakers with valuable insights into ethical and responsible AI implementation.
- Grayscale's new AI fund features five key protocols, reflecting the increasing investment in AI technologies.
- G-Retriever is advancing real-world graph question answering with the use of RAG and LLMs, enhancing the accuracy and efficiency of answering complex questions based on graph data.
